intro: Hemizonia parryi subsp. typica, commonly known as the Parry's hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Hemizonia parryi subsp. typica is adapted to arid conditions and is a hardy perennial that blooms in spring.
